author: A_Brickset_user
title: It should have had the Admiral
review: This set came with the rare (at the time) Captain Roger and lady pirate, as well as two naval officers.  However, it should have come with Admiral Broadside, 'cause he's rare and also the officers are gonna get clobbered, even if they are sneaking up on the pirates :).  All in all, though, good set for acsessories and 2/3 rare figures.

author: MPH
title: OK
review: Nothing special (well, maybe the female pirate), but it's always nice to expand your minifig collection. I would have liked one more soldier though, because my pirates are starting to outnumber my soldiers by quite a margin. But then again, this is "lego pirates" and not "lego soldiers", right?

author: Gus_263
title: Pirates Minifigures
review: This set is small, just like some other pirates sets from their first years, but this features some minifigures. The mini figures uses a good design on each, and also the pirates classic style. The minifigures included are two male pirates (one pirate and one captain), one female pirate minifigure and two soldiers. The hats, weapons and the wood leg of the captain are in a cool model to use on all the mini figures. This set also includes a bird and a treasure, that be very well in other pirates themes and like all the pieces on the set are very useful. There are no much pieces, because this set is basically made to feature only minifigures. The playability is also just like all the other, and the set still in classic style. So, i rate the Pirate Mini Figures 5/5

author: AETerry
title: Pirates Minifigures Review
review:
This collection of Pirate minfigures came out in the first year or so of the theme's introduction.

 

Minifigure collections like this have always been good for the number of new figures provided to extend out play or armies in other larger sets. As such, there usually isn't any build involved other then putting minifigures together.

 

You have 3 Pirates, Captain Redbeard himself, a rare or uncommon female pirate and red shirt pirate swabbie or mate. Two Imperial soldiers, parrot and a chest with gold coins.

author: Odeinoichus
title: Mini-Figure Battle Packs before Licensed Themes
review:
Set #6251 Pirate Mini-Figures: Back in the early days of the LEGO Pirates System this Mini-Figure collection was a must have item for children and parents on a budget.

 

The Pirate Mini-Figures in this collection included the rare, hard to find at a cheap price Female Pirate, Captain Redbeard, a Male Pirate and two Imperial Soldiers, as well as a parrot, a chest full of gold and weapons galore. Perfect for starting a little bit of playtime for the kids.

 

Overall I'd say that this set was definitely a great value, as the Female Pirate Mini-Fig was a rarity and this was the cheapest set to feature her. A great value for your dollar, it's a bit of a shame that most Mini-Figure collections these days cost more and can only be found through LEGO S&H for the Themes that aren't Licensed.

author: MatthewLM
title: Not a bad mini-figure set.
review:
In 1989, the Lego Pirates were introduced and kids rejoiced. However for the several whose parents could not afford a Black Seas Barracuda, they had to make do with some of the cheaper ones or if you're just starting off, this is a good beginning.

You get three pirates. The mighty Captain Red Beard, the wench, which you couldn't find elsewhere in cheaper sets, and the scruffy red shirt mustachioed pirate. You also get an Imperial commander and a soldier. Also a parrot and gold. Can't have a pirate set without the two. You have some playability. You could have the two parties fight over gold or just fight in general, among other scenarios. If I can think of a couple of down points, there should be more guns so the figures would have a bit of versatility to battle each other. And another soldier wouldn't hurt to balance it all out (not to mention build the French army).

Could've been a little bit more, but not a bad set in its own right.

title: "Yo ho ho and a bottle of rum!"
